articles.author: Francois Murphy, John Irish
articles.description: Western powers are preparing to push the U.N. nuclear watchdog's board at its next quarterly meeting to declare Iran in breach of its non-proliferation obligations for the first time in almost 20 years, a move bound to enrage Tehran, diplomats said.
articles.title: Exclusive: West plans to push IAEA board to find Iran in breach of duties, diplomats say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The plan seen by Reuters includes sending aid to Gaza as soon as Hamas signs off on the ceasefire agreement.
articles.title: US proposes 60-day ceasefire for Gaza, plan shows

articles.author: Christian Lowe, Dmitry Antonov
articles.description: Ukraine resisted pressure from Moscow and Washington to commit itself to attending peace talks with Russia on June 2, saying it first needed to see the proposals Russian negotiators plan to bring to the talks.
articles.title: Ukraine keeps Russia guessing over participation in June 2 peace talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police have said the incident, which left a total of 79 people injured, was isolated and not an act of terrorism.
articles.title: UK man appears in court over Liverpool parade incident that hurt dozens

articles.author: Andrew Chung
articles.description: The move bolsters the Republican president's drive to step up deportations.
articles.title: US Supreme Court lets Trump revoke 'parole' status for migrants

articles.author: Fanny Potkin, Xinghui Kok, Idrees Ali
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Friday that division between the two superpowers, the United States and China, is the main risk currently confronting the world as he emphasised the need for building new coalitions between Paris and partners in the Indo-Pacific.
articles.title: France's Macron calls for Asian coalitions as he warns of US-China divisions

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Andrew Gray, Idrees Ali, Sabine Siebold
articles.description: President Trump will maintain the traditional role of a U.S. general at the helm of NATO even as Washington pushes European allies to take more responsibility for their security.
articles.title: Exclusive: America's next top general in Europe will also lead NATO forces, officials say

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: In the dark, brick-walled basement of the Kharkiv National Academic Opera and Ballet Theatre, a dance company has created a space protected from drones and bombs where audiences can lose themselves in performances of classic ballets.
articles.title: In Ukraine's Kharkiv, ballet offers 'rebirth' after bombs and bullets

articles.author: Alan Charlish
articles.description: The centrist frontrunner in Poland's knife-edge presidential election on Sunday says Poles know everything about him, contrasting that with the slew of media reports about his nationalist opponent's alleged past conduct.
articles.title: Punch-ups and tobacco pouches: Polish presidential race gets personal

articles.author: Aaron Ross
articles.description: Lawyers for Tanzania's jailed opposition leader Tundu Lissu filed a complaint on Friday to the United Nations Working Group on Arbitrary Detention in a bid to ramp up international pressure for his release.
articles.title: Tanzanian politician's lawyers ask UN to declare his detention arbitrary
